clues.text: Before the Olympics went all-metric, the 1904 games had events like the 880 of these units freestyle swim

The 1924 Olympics played backdrop to this film about 2 British runners

A field event, the long jump favors athletes with track star speed, like this U.S. man who won 4 straight golds in the event
Typically, 19th century lieder, or songs, were arranged for 1 vocalist & 1 accompanist on this instrument
Lieder date back to the 12th century but really hit their stride during this emotional musical era that began in the 18th century
The French followed the Germans' lied with a form called melodie, like Henri Duparc's this French word for song "Triste"

A section of it runs for some 5,500 miles from Liaoning province to Gansu
It was originally made of barbed wire on the night of August 12-13, 1961
A rabbinic belief is that the divine presence never departs from this wall in Jerusalem
Sacsayhuaman is a walled fortress near Cuzco, ancient capital of this empire
A book about Frank Calvert & Heinrich Schliemann is called "Finding the Walls of" this city
Joe Pesci & Daniel Stern were the bumbling burglars foiled by Macaulay Culkin in this 1990 film

This "avian" party dance topped a 2017 list of what brides told DJs not to play
"They all want me, they can't have me" in this '90s hit song that became its own dance craze; hey!
A song that was No. 1 in the summer of 1960 begins, "Come on, baby, let's do" this dance
Introduced to the U.S. from Cuba around 1914, this dance is done quick-quick-slow in 4/4 time; let's get ready to...!
This type of updated work is from Latin for "see again"

There's a diner foodstuff in this verb meaning to go over something again & again &...

These 2 similar words have similar meanings; the one starting "A" can mean to make any change; the "E" is to change the text

rounds.category: BREAKING UP IS HARD TO DO

clues.text: The first attempt to break up this communications company was in 1949; it finally happened in the '80s
In 1989 these 2 actors decided to rekindle their relationship; actress Dakota Johnson resulted
In 2000 this company was ordered to split Windows & Internet Explorer into 2 companies but appealed successfully
This country was partitioned in 1772, with Austria getting Auschwitz; it was back together in 1918
After other failed attempts, a 1911 federal lawsuit finally split this oil trust into more than 30 companies

rounds.category: A WAR BY ANY OTHER NAME

clues.text: In the South, the American Civil War is sometimes called the War of Northern this 10-letter word

This country's 17th century civil wars are also known as "The Great Rebellion"
The Ramadan War of 1973 is also called this, after a holiday of a different religion
The Great Narragansett War is another name for this king's war
Since China was mostly peasants, its 1st translation of this 1848 Marx-Engels work used "common people", not "workers"
From 1919 to 1925 moderate socialist Friedrich Ebert led the German government known as this
In April 1965 this international pot stirrer left Cuba to try to bring revolution to Africa
In 1948 Henry Wallace got 2.4% of the vote as the pres. candidate of the party with this forward-looking name

the one containing a "C" hangs from the ceiling, the one with a "G" rises from the ground
